message_1: How many ways are there to partition a set of 6 elements into non-empty subsets?
message_2:
To find the number of ways to partition a set of 6 elements into non-empty subsets, we can use the Bell number. The Bell number B(n) is the number of ways to partition a set of n elements into non-empty subsets. 

For n = 6, the Bell number B(6) is 203.

So, there are 203 ways to partition a set of 6 elements into non-empty subsets.
